body_html:
Thank you so much! Thanks to you i can complete my thesis :)
I didn't know this function, only the sorted version. It returns exactly the same values, with the bonus that i can choose the number of bins with the third argument. It runs quite fast, albeit goes on CPU a bit slower than bincount. It could still be very interesting to know if, with bincount on GPU, i can improve performance of my code. Unfortunately i have to do weighted histograms with a big amount of data.

body:
Thank you so much! Thanks to you i can complete my thesis :)
I didn't know this function, only the sorted version. It returns exactly the same values, with the bonus that i can choose the number of bins with the third argument. It runs quite fast, albeit goes on CPU a bit slower than `bincount`. It could still be very interesting to know if, with `bincount` on GPU, i can improve performance of my code. Unfortunately i have to do weighted histograms with a big amount of data.
